result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon S. Steuck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two or if not, then 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with S.S.

Any assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.
DNA Sample if not already provided in Wood County case.
Court finds defendant is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Wood County. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CF275, filed in 14CF278)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:15 am 
INCLUDES 14CF275 AND 14CF278. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Def appears in person with Atty Austin Mort.  

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 14CF275 AND 14CF278. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed. Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF275 AND 14CF278. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF275: Ct. 2 (Forgery - Uttering)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF278: Ct. 2 (Forgery - Uttering)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: In 14CF275: Ct. 1 (Forgery - Uttering)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : In 14CF278: Ct. 1 (Forgery - Uttering)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Mort makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 106 days jail with electronic monitor or huber if deft qualifies under jail criteria in 14CF275 only; any assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety; no contact with S.S.; DNA Sample if not already provided in Wood County case; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not 10 hours community service per week; court cost. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT notes probation may be transferred to Wood County. 

Adj: 9:36 am
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Preliminary Hearing on June 3, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on May 12, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
